question: Sudanâ€™s first ever satellite has been launched into the space by which country?
explanation: Sudan\'s first ever satellite SRSS-1 has been launched by China. The satellite was launched from north China\'s Shanxi Province. It aims to develop research in space technology, acquire data as well as discover natural resources for the country\'s military needs. The remote-sensing satellite aims to advance research in space technology. Its main objective is to acquire the required data as well as discover natural resources for the country\'s military needs. It will generate a comprehensive, cost-effective and reliable database on the topographic, mapping and natural resources of Sudan.
